column4: oh split-sh!t, the upgrade from feisty to gutsy is blowing some hairy goat nads.
!gutsy
gdm won't work right, but X by itself will
it shouldn't be this way, it should simply work right
!sound
it's not an ordinary sound problem, I've already tried the Comprehensive Sound Guide of Ubuntu Forums
to say what it is
s/to/so/g
can't help you unless you provide more info
well when I run lsusb: my sound is seen as "Bus 001 Device 008: ID 0d8c:0201 C-Media Electronics, Inc. ";
and when I run aplay -L: "card 1: default [PnP Audio Device        ], device 0: USB Audio [USB Audio]"
I tried following a comprehensive sound guide but when I enter "alsamixer" I get an error
alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such device
anything in /proc/asound/cards?
is that a directory..?
it's a file, cat it
yeah:  "1 [default        ]: USB-Audio - PnP Audio Device"
and u have some sort of usb headphones or something plugged in?
No. It's my onboard sound. It's located on the USB bus rather than on the PCI bus like usual
never heard of it, what make/model is that?
It's a terrible motherboard; lol. It's an ASUS M2N-Plus SLI
It's C-Media 6501 I think.. the sound chipset
any ideas..?
